    Team

    The SCorCH team is spread between the University of Manchester and the University of Oxford.

    Giles Reger

    Giles Reger is a Senior Lecturer in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Manchester. He has joint expertise in automated reasoning and runtime verification. He is a lead developer of the Vampire theorem prover and MarQ runtime verification tool.

    Website

    Tom Melham

    Tom Melham is a Professor in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Oxford. He is an expert in formal hardware verification, model checking, and theorem proving.

    Website

    Daniel Kroening

    Daniel Kroening is a Senior Principal Scientist at Amazon Web Services and a Professor in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Oxford. He is well known for his contributions to model checking and decision procedures for automated software analysis. He leads the development of the CBMC model checker.

    Website

    Lucas Corderio

    Lucas Cordeiro is a Senior Lecturer in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Manchester. He has joint expertise in software model checking, automated testing, and program synthesis. He leads the development of the ESBMC model checker.

    Website

    Konstantin Korovin

    Konstantin Korovin is a Senior Lecturer in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Manchester. He has joint expertise in automated reasoning and hardware model checking. He leads the development of the iProver theorem prover.

    Website

    Pierre Olivier

    Pierre Olivier is a Lecturer in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Manchester. He works in systems software with a focus on systems security. He co-designed SlimGuard, a secure and efficient dynamic memory allocator.

    Website

    Mustafa A. Mustafa

    Mustafa A. Mustafa is a Dame Kathleen Ollerenshaw Research Fellow in the Department of Computer Science at The University of Manchester. His research expertise includes information security, data privacy and applied cryptography.

    Website

    Fedor Shmarov

    Fedor Shmarov is a Research Associate in the Department of Computer Science at The University of Manchester. His research expertise include model checking and formal verification of stochastic hybrid systems.

    Website

    Ahmed Bhayat

    Ahmed Bhayat is a Research Assistant in the Department of Computer Science at The University of Manchester. Amongst his areas of interests are automated reasoning, lambda calculus and type theory. He is involved in the development of the Vampire theorem prover.

    Website

    You?

    We are looking for a talented Research Associate to join the team in Oxford. Could this be you?

    Find Out More

    Advisory Board

    SCorCH will be guided by an advisory board consisting of the following:

    • Travis Walton, Distinguished Engineer at Arm
    • Professor Byron Cook, University College London/Amazon Web Services
    • Professor Peter Sewell, University of Cambridge
    • Professor Mikel Luján, University of Manchester
